column100:
Innovative Space Company is looking for a Commercial Product Manager 
 For our Products team, we are looking for a Commercial Product Manager. They will have the opportunity to become part of an internationally oriented and dedicated team aiming at providing exceptional Nanosatellite solutions to customers on the global market. 
 You will have the opportunity to support this new, strategic direction that implies increased professionalism around product management and new product development to maximise our value of both existing and new products. 
 The role as Commercial Product Manager can be supported from any GomSpace facility in Denmark, Luxembourg, Sweden, or France. However, you must use significant time in our headquarter in Aalborg, Denmark. You will work closely with the Chief Product Officer, head of departments for our three product departments (Radio, Platform, Software), as well as Product Owners organised within these departments and the Sales organisation. 
 As Commercial Product Manager, your responsibilities will be to evaluate product portfolio and roadmap fit to market conditions and sales strategy, provide data and market feedback to product development projects, and furthermore to provide sales forecasting and product life-cycle planning. 
 
The Job Includes the Following Set of Tasks: 
 
 Actively contribute and be the Voice of Product in the GomSpace market and competitor analysis to ensure aligned and refined input to roadmap process 
 Evaluate/propose “productisation” route of existing non-standard offering in GomSpace portfolio 
 Develop and maintain business cases within investment projects 
 Develop high-level product story & commercial requirements 
 Prepare and execute product launch with the Marketing team 
 Support sales forecasting with the manufacturing organisation and Sales 
 Actively contribute to product positioning including pricing for product portfolio in the view to optimise earnings. 
 Analyse buying patterns (product options) and suggest improvements 
 Perform product life cycle planning in collaboration with Product Owners  
 
   
 We expect the Employee to Have the Following Qualifications: 
 
 A relevant Bachelor of Science or a higher degree in a technical field (physics, electronics, software, communication, or systems engineering) 
 Minimum 3-5 years of work experience in relevant positions 
 A broad overview of space technology and spacecraft design 
 Experience within the commercial side of business operations 
 Strong communication skills both vocally and in writing as well as in presentations 
 The ability to approach problem-solving top-down 
 The ability to interface and collaborate with different personalities from the very technical to the very commercial-minded 
 Driven to deliver 
 
   
 GomSpace offers employment in a diverse, dynamic growing, and internationally oriented company with many challenging and exciting activities. We are an agenda-setting player in the nanosatellite business and expect our employees to contribute with dedication, skills, and the will to implement our mission. We are ambitious and believe that nanosatellites and our efforts will make a difference to society in the future. We have an informal working culture with transparent communication and an organisation built up by multidisciplinary skills and engineering passion which we believe are essential to help our customers achieve their goals in space.    
 
Sign Up for Our Mission:  
   
 Apply for the job here. You are welcome to send your application in either Danish or English. Interviews will be conducted continuously. If you have any questions with regard to the position, do not hesitate to contact  Lars Alminde  at  alminde@gomspace.com 
 The workplace will be at one of our offices in Denmark, France, Luxemburg, or Sweden. Salary and start date will be individually negotiated. 
 We kindly draw your attention to the fact that we do not receive applications and resumes via e-mail or by personal appearance. This is to protect and show consideration for your personal information. Apply for the job by following the link below. 
 About GomSpace   |  GomSpace is a globally leading designer, integrator, and manufacturer of high-end nanosatellites for customers in the academic, government, and commercial markets. Our positions of strength include systems integration, nanosatellite subsystems, and advanced miniaturised radio technology. Our international team is devoted to understanding our customer’s requirements and deliver flawlessly. We are listed in Stockholm (GOMX), headquartered in Denmark, and have subsidiaries in Sweden, Singapore, North America, and Luxembourg. We are more than 200 employees servicing customers in more than 55 countries. Learn more on www.gomspace.com
